content.description:
P1 (5.8) - Easy chimney start with two bolts to protect (painted tan and blend in very well with rock; trust me, they are there). After second bolt, exit to ledge and continue up crack seam to a two bolt anchor. There is still quite a bit of rat skat up here. We tried to clean this up fairly well but there was only so much we could do. Enjoy. 

 P2 (5.10) - Employ at little mixed technique to establish in the crack system off the ground. Use a combination of jams and face features to pull the roof. Once over roof, traverse slightly left to establish in crack seam and take it to a two bolt anchor. Make sure you leave a directional low when establishing in the left crack seam to the top; I bumped a cam here on the FA and created some unnecessary drag/rope pinching. 

 Note: This is sandstone climbing. We tested all of the face and crack features and everything that is left is fairly solid.
content.protection: Single - 4-6, Doubles - .3-.75, Triple - 1-3 (although you can get by with doubles), plenty of runners
content.location: When walking down the trail, the feature will be on your right. Look for rock path to cross the creek.

content.description: Climb finger-sized crack that widens and gets quite nice. At the overhanging hand crack at the top, surf the jugs to the anchors.  Loose anchor bolt replaced as of 2019.
content.protection: Doubles from .4 to 2 (BD). As of 1/2/2019: Anchor is now two good bolts.
content.location: Just upstream from the descent trail into the canyon, on the right. Cross the creek and hike uphill on the right side of the large fin that has the hole in it. This climb ascends the left dihedral at the top of the hill.

content.description: First pitch is very nice hands and foot jams, rock is sound but sandy in spots 5.9+. Second pitch starts up short arching offwidth crack to traverse move past a bolt and balancy moves past buldge to top.
content.location: On a fin just upstream of where the trail comes to the stream. As you walk upstream its to your right. It's the same fin that Moqui Dogway is on-just on the other side. You cross the water just upstream of the fin, bushwack up a bit then go under the fin though a neat little arch to the other side. The route starts and continues to follow a large Pine all the way to it's top, keeping it mostly in the shade even on sunny afternoons!

content.description: Very enjoyable offwidth. Highly recommend for those wide officianados or someone trying to get a little more wide technique under their belt. Don't let the roof moves down low intimidate you; channel your inner Oreo and grovel on up!
content.location: When walking down the main trail, approaching the creek, turn right and head towards the feature housing Wave Rider and Bikini Run. ODD is in a slot to the right of that feature.

content.description: Starts on the upstream side of the fin, somewhat hidden by the trees at it's bottom. Goes up nice hand crack to strenuous transition move left then up dicey vein of rock with crack on either side to two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Doubles to #4, #5 optional, triples of 3 and 4 might be nice.
content.location: Ascends bottom half of large, obvious fin viewed just after you cross the stream from the trail bottom. It is seen on the right side of the stream as you walk upstream.

content.description:
Although we thought about it, Scott and I did not do the FA in our bikinis. Had it been mostly 4s, we probably could have gotten away with it. The name is derived from the flock of individuals down at the beach whom were wearing bikinis and singing our praises on the FA day. Nothing like sunshine and bikinis to really make you try hard and feel like a hero.

P1 - Climb the chimney pitch of Wave Rider to get to the anchors.

P2 - From the anchors, traverse right and start up the wide squeeze. Squeeze, grovel, and lieback your way up the crack system. Very important, don't forget to wink and wave to the beach-goers as you pull through the hero roof. And remember, if you take a screamer, that little kids down at the beach will never forget it. A #7 will make the upper section of this pitch more comfortable but it is not required.
content.protection: Singles - some micros, 1-4   Doubles - 5-6   Optional - 7 or blue big bro   Slings
content.location: When arriving at the creek from the main trail, the feature will be visible to your right. Route is to the right of Wave Rider.

content.description: Routes/walls from trail bottom/logs to Knot Unknown
